pages.text: Our official Shopping Districts are the place to buy and sell goods! Now with a light roleplay twist- the Districts are home to the the 6 Courts of Commerce, a pantheon of trade and economy that guides the entrepreneurs and crafters who offer their goods and services.
Players may own a total of three (3) shops, each of which may qualify to join separate Courts.

pages.title: §n§lWhat Are They?
pages.text: District Shops should focus on a $(l)clear, specific theme$(). Theme defines the atmosphere of your shop as well as the types of items sold.$(br2)An example of a shop that is $(o)narrow in theme$() is $(l)Fate and Flame$(). This shop focuses on selling candles and heads to rest your candles on.

District Shops should be $(l)narrow in scope$().$(br2)The range of items should remain $(l)limited$() to what fits within the scope of your shop idea, ensuring a $(l)unique$() shop experience and leaving $(l)space for other shops$() with similar themes.

An example of a shop that is $(o)narrow in scope$() is $(l)The Beastro$().$(br2)This shop is one of many that follow the theme of a restaurant, or selling food. However, the shop focuses on selling meals made from only terrestrial beasts.

pages.title: §n§lEarning Lunar
pages.text: $(br)Remember that lunar is $(l)not locked$() to the shopping district. We encourage players to charge for mini-games or events they've made, add gift shops to their builds, or sell other commemorative items!

pages.title: §n§lOutside the District
pages.text: $(br)If you sell something a district shop sells, $(l)you must sell it for more$().$(br2)The mod team recommendation is to add 5 Lunar (1 days worth of $(t:Universal Basic Income)UBI$()) to the price you would sell your item for
